```{r}
Wake_county <- read.csv("http://tiny.cc/dcf/street-addresses.csv", stringsAsFactors=FALSE)
download.file(url="http://tiny.cc/dcf/CMS_ProvidersSimple.rds", destfile= "CMS_ProvidersSimple.rds")
Medicare <- readRDS("CMS_ProvidersSimple.rds")
```

```{r}
pattern <- "(ST| RD| ROAD| CIRCLE| CIR| AVE| AVENUE| LANE| LN| DRIVE| DR| PLACE| PL| BOULEVARD| BLVD| WAY| BOX| TRL| HWY| VALLEY| SEBTS| LA| CT| TRAIL| HALL| UNIVERSITY| COURT| CO| PATH| LOOP| PO BX|BOX | PKWY| TR| BLUFFS| FARM| BLV| TERRACE| PEAKWAY|  HIGHWAY | TER| GLEN| HOSPITAL| ECU| ASU| CENTER| XING| PARKWAY| RIDGE| PASS| SUITE| DAIRY| BX| MEADOW| RUN| HILLS| APT| DORM| PARK| CREEK| TOWN| HILL| SAVE| EVANS| SOUTH |  NEUSE| WALKWAY| UNIT | CALLE| ALLEY)"
LeftOvers <- Wake_county %>% filter(! grepl(pattern, address,!grepl(" BOX ", address)))
dim(LeftOvers)
```

```{r}
Street_names <- 
  Wake_county %>% 
  tidyr::extract(address, into="street_word", regex=pattern, remove=FALSE) %>% 
  group_by(street_word) %>% 
  summarise(total=n()) %>% 
  arrange(desc(total))
Street_names %>% print.data.frame()
```

Street names is the name of the new table

Wake county is the source data

the tidr line is setting up the new table

group by is grouping it by address type

summarise is counting how many incidences of each street type

arrange is putting them in order of least to most popular

Street names is printing the final table
